setting.name: displayName
setting.description: Display name used for local user interface as well as SIP signaling.

setting.name: address
setting.label: User Address
setting.type: string in the format user or user@domain
setting.description: user or user@domain. If only user is entered (e.g. '1002'), the implied domain will be the registration server.

setting.name: label
setting.description: Text label to appear on the display adjacent to the associated line key. If omitted, the label will be derived from the user part of 'Registration Server'

setting.name: type
setting.description: If set to private, use standard call signaling. If set to shared, augment call signaling with call state subscriptions and notifications and use access control for outgoing calls.

setting.name: thirdPartyName
setting.type: string in the same format as reg.x.address
setting.description: This field must match the Address value of the other registration which makes up the bridged line.

setting.name: auth.userId
setting.description: User ID to be used for authentication challenges for this registration. If non-Null, will override the 'Reg User' parameter entered into the Authentication submenu off of the Settings menu on the phone.

setting.name: auth.password
setting.description: Password to be used for authentication challenges for this registration. If non-Null, will override the 'Reg Password' parameter entered into the Authentication submenu off of the Settings menu on the phone.

setting.name: server.1.address
setting.label: Primary Registration Server
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: Primary Registration Server. IP address or host name of a SIP server that accepts registrations.

setting.name: server.2.address
setting.label: Secondary Registration Server
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: Backup IP address or host name, port, transport, registration period, fail-over parameters and lineseize subscription period of a SIP server that accepts registrations. Multiple servers can be listed starting with y=1, 2, ... for fault tolerance. If specified, these servers will over-ride the servers specified Server settings

setting.name: autoOffHook.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, a call will be automati-cally placed to the contact specified upon going off hook on this regis-tration.

setting.name: autoOffHook.contact
setting.type: ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@polycom.com)

setting.name: serverMissedCall.enabled
setting.description: If set to 0, all missed-call events will increment the counter If set to 1, only missed-call events sent by the server will increment the counter.

group.name: divert
group.label: Diversion
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP contains a flexible call forward/diversion feature for each registration. In all cases, a call will only be diverted if a non-Null contact has been configured. In the following tables, x is the registration number. IP 300: x=1-2; IP 500: x=1-3; IP 600: x=1-6

setting.name: contact
setting.type: ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that consti-tutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@poly-com.com)
setting.description: The forward-to contact used for all automatic call diversion features unless overridden by a specific contact of a per-call diver-sion feature (see below).

setting.name: autoOnSpecificCaller
setting.description: If set to 1, calls may be diverted using the Auto Divert feature of the direc-tory. This is a global flag.

setting.name: sharedDisabled
setting.description: If set to 1, all diversion fea-tures on that line will be disabled if the line is con-figured as shared.

setting.name: fwd.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, the user will be able to enable uni-versal call forwarding via the soft key menu.

setting.name: divert.busy.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on busy to the contact specified below.

setting.name: divert.busy.contact
setting.type: ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@polycom.com)
setting.description: Forward-to contact for calls forwarded due to busy status, if Null, divert.x.contact will be used.

setting.name: divert.noanswer.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be for-warded on no answer to the contact specified.

setting.name: divert.noanswer.timeout
setting.description: Time in seconds to allow altering before initiating the diversion.

setting.name: divert.noanswer.contact
setting.type: ASCII encoded string con-taining digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@poly-com.com)
setting.description: Forward-to contact used for calls forwarded due to no answer, if Null, divert.x.contact will be used.

setting.name: divert.dnd.enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on DND to the contact specified below.

setting.name: divert.dnd.contact
setting.type: ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@poly-com.com)
setting.description: Forward-to contact used for calls forwarded due to DND status, if Null divert.x.contact will be used.

setting.name: impossibleMatchHandling
setting.description: When present, and if no digitmap setting are set, this attribute overrides the global dial plan in Dial Plan settings.

setting.name: removeEndOfDial
setting.description: When present, and if no digitmap setting are set, this attribute overrides the global dial plan in Dial Plan settings.

setting.name: digitmap
setting.type: string compatible with the digit map feature of MGCP described in 2.1.5 of RFC 3435; string is limited to 512 bytes and 20 segments; a comma is also allowed; when reached in the digit map, a comma will turn dial tone back on.
setting.description: When present, this attribute overrides the global dial plan defined Phone's Dial Plan settings

setting.name: digitmap.timeOut
setting.description: When present, this attribute overrides the global dial plan defined Phone's Dial Plan settings

setting.name: server.y.address
setting.type: dotted-decimal IP address or host name
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that will be used for routing calls. Multiple servers can be listed starting with y=1, 2, ... for fault tolerance.

setting.name: routing.emergency.y.value
setting.type: Comma separated list of entries or single entry representing a or a combination of SIP URL.
setting.description: This represents the URLs that should be watched for emergency routing. When one of these defined URL is detected as being dialed by the user, the call will be automatically directed to the defined emergency server.

setting.name: routing.emergency.y.server.z
setting.description: Index representing the server defined in Emergency Settings that will be used for emergency routing.

group.name: msg.mwi
group.label: Messaging
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP supports message-waiting indication on a per-registration basis.

setting.name: subscribe
setting.type: ASCII encoded string con-taining digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@poly-com.com)
setting.description: If non-Null, the phone will send a SUBSCRIBE request to this contact after boot-up.

setting.name: callBackMode
setting.description: If set to 'contact', a call will be placed to the contact specified in the callback attribute when the user invokes message retrieval. If set to 'registration', a call will be placed using this registration to the con-tact registered (the phone will call itself). If set to 'disabled', mes-sage retrieval is disabled.

setting.name: callBack
setting.type: ASCII encoded string con-taining digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@poly-com.com)
setting.description: Contact to call when retrieving messages for this registration.
